alert.note: Alert for Butler; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 1:26AM CDT until June 01 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL BUTLER, NORTHERN ELK, GREENWOOD, WESTERN WILSON AND WOODSON COUNTIES... At 126 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated continued scattered thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since late Tuesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to perhaps 2 inches are possible in the warned area overnight. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, highways, streets, county roads, low-water crossings, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Eureka, Fredonia, Yates Center, Howard, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Rosalia, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Fall River Lake, Fall River State Park, Cross Timbers State Park, Toronto Lake and Eureka Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
